si.t: The data may be missing values, which the spreadsheet program may fill in with ZEROs, affecting calculations. (For example, the AVERAGE of a column [2,4,] should be 3, but gives 2 because of 0-filling.) We fill empty cells by using =IF(<cell>="",$M$3,<cell>), M3 replacing.
In order to sample the data into training and testing data, we first add an index column, assigning a random index with a uniform distribution (for example, Unif[0, 1]) to it.
Sorting the table by the index column shuffles the rows.

We no longer need the index, and empty replacements (#N/A) won’t be in real data, so discard these. Let’s choose a test proportion of 20% from this we can calculate the range of the test data. We take that range as the test data.

The following rows up until the end become the training data. We delete the training data from this copy of the table. Additionally, we KEEP the blank replacement (#N/A). I added a corresponding index to show these are the correct rows (remember to remove it).
